content.question: A function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> satisfies <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3, of, f of x, equals 6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>â†’</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 1 through 6, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers 1 through 7, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. The graph consists of one curve and two line segments. An open circle and a closed circle are included in the graph. The graph begins with a curve that begins on the y axis, just below 1. It moves upward and to the right until it ends at an open circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 4. Directly above the open circle, is a closed circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 6. The first line segment begins at the closed circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 6, and moves downward and to the right. It passes through the point with coordinates 4 comma 5, and ends at the point with coordinates 5 comma 4. The second line segment begins where the first line segment ends, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends to the right of the point with coordinates 6 comma 4.

The figure presents the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 1 through 6, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers 1 through 7, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. The graph is a curve. Two open circles and two closed circles are included in the graph. The graph begins on the y axis at 2. It moves upward and to the right, passing through the point with coordinates 2 comma 3, until it reaches an open circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 4. Directly above this open circle, is a closed circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 6. The curve begins again at the open circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 4. It moves upward and to the right until it reaches a second open circle at the point with coordinates 5 comma 6. Directly below this open circle, is a closed circle at the point with coordinates 5 comma 1. The curve begins again at the open circle at the point with coordinates 5 comma 6. It moves upward and to the right, and passes through the point with coordinates 6 comma 7 before it ends.

The figure presents the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 1 through 6, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers 1 through 7, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. The graph consists of two line segments. An open circle and a closed circle are included in the graph. The first line segment begins on the y axis at 6. It moves horizontally to the right until it reaches an open circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 6. Directly below the open circle, is a closed circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 4. The second line segment begins at the open circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 6, and moves downward and to the right. It passes through the point with coordinates 4 comma 4, and the point with coordinates 5 comma 2, before it ends on the x axis at 6.

The figure presents the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 1 through 6, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers 1 through 7, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. The graph is a parabola that opens upward. The vertex is at a closed circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 2. Two other closed circles are indicated on the parabola at the point with coordinates 0 comma 6, and the point with coordinates 6 comma 6.

content.answer: The figure presents the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 1 through 6, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers 1 through 7, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. The graph consists of two line segments. An open circle and a closed circle are included in the graph. The first line segment begins on the y axis at 6. It moves horizontally to the right until it reaches an open circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 6. Directly below the open circle, is a closed circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 4. The second line segment begins at the open circle at the point with coordinates 3 comma 6, and moves downward and to the right. It passes through the point with coordinates 4 comma 4, and the point with coordinates 5 comma 2, before it ends on the x axis at 6.
